abstract.text: A class that validates advertisement-driven app installations.

inlineContent.text: Use
for app ad campaigns on the App Store and alternative marketplaces. See the

for information on how AdAttributionKit helps advertisers measure the success of ad campaigns while helping maintain user privacy. For information on interoperability between SKAdNetwork and AdAttributionKit, see
The ad network API helps advertisers measure the success of ad campaigns while maintaining user privacy. The API involves three participants:
Ad networks
that sign ads and receive install-validation postbacks after ads result in conversions
Source apps
that display ads from the ad networks, or websites that display the ads in Safari
Advertised apps
that update conversion values as people engage with the app

Ad networks register with Apple to get an ad network ID and to use the API. Developers configure their apps to accept attributable ads from ad networks, and to receive copies of winning postbacks. For information about setup, see
, and
. For information about displaying ads in Safari, see

The following diagram shows the path of an ad impression that wins ad attribution. The ad network serves an ad that an app or Safari web page displays. A user taps the ad and downloads the advertised app.

Apple determines a postback data tier for the app download, and the device uses the tier later to determine the level of detail the postback can contain to ensure crowd anonymity. For more information about the postback contents and the data tiers, see

If the user launches the app within an attribution time-window, the ad impression is eligible for install-attribution postbacks. As the user engages with the app, the app updates the conversion value. Starting in iOS 16.1, apps can update conversion values during three conversion windows, which results in up to three postbacks for an ad signed using version 4. The system sends the postbacks to the ad network, and to the app’s developer if they opt in to receive postbacks.
Devices send install-validation postbacks to multiple ad networks that sign their ads using version 3 or later.
One ad network receives a postback with a
parameter value of
for the ad impression that wins the ad attribution.
Up to five other ad networks receive a postback with a
parameter value of
if their ad impressions qualify for the attribution, but don’t win.
The following diagram shows the path of ad impressions that qualify for, but don’t win, the ad attribution. Up to five ad networks receive a single nonwinning postback.
For more information about receiving ad attributions, including time-window details and other constraints, see

The information in the postback that Apple cryptographically signs doesn’t include user- or device-specific data. It may include values from the ad network and the advertised app if providing those values meets Apple’s privacy threshold. For more information about postback values and postback data tiers, see
. For more information about the contents of postbacks for each SKAdNetwork version, see

content.text: Presenting ads, updating conversion values, and receiving attribution

inlineContent.text: Each participant has specific responsibilities when using the ad network APIs to present ads and receive attribution.
The ad network’s responsibilities are to:
Register and provide its ad network identifier to developers. See
Serve signed ads to the source app. See
Serve signed ads for display in Safari web pages. See the
API.
Receive install-validation postbacks at the URL it establishes during registration.
Verify the postbacks. See
The source app’s responsibilities are to:
Add the ad network identifiers to its
file. See
Display ads that the ad network signs. See
The advertised app’s responsibilities are to:
Register an app installation by updating the conversion value when the user first launches the app by calling one of the conversion updating methods, such as
Optionally, continue to update the conversion value as the user engages with the app, by calling one of the conversion updating methods, such as
Optionally, specify a server URL in its
file to receive a copy of the winning install-validation postback. See
Apple designs SKAdNetwork APIs to maintain user privacy. Apps don’t need to use
before calling SKAdNetwork APIs, and can call these APIs regardless of their tracking authorization status. For more information about privacy, see

The SKAdNetwork APIs have no effect, return empty strings, or return values that indicate unavailability when you call the APIs from a compatible iPad or iPhone app running in macOS or visionOS, from a Mac app built with Mac Catalyst, or from an App Clip’s code. For more information about App Clips, see

abstract.text: Present, process, and register postbacks for in-app ads in the App Store and alternative app marketplaces.
Learn how attribution APIs interact to deliver ad impressions.
Provide people a shortcut to selected content and features of your app.
Request user authorization to access app-related data for tracking the user or the device.
The URL where Private Click Measurement and SKAdNetwork send attribution information.
An array of dictionaries containing a list of ad network IDs.
Attribute app-install campaigns that originate on the web.
Validate your ad impressions and test your postbacks by creating unit tests using the StoreKit Test framework.

abstract.text: Support In-App Purchases and interactions with the App Store.
A class that defines an ad impression for a view-through ad.
A class that validates advertisement-driven app installations.
Coarse values to use for updating conversion values.
Indicates that your app is no longer presenting a view-through ad to the user.
Verifies the first launch of an app installed as a result of an ad.
Indicates that your app is presenting a view-through ad to the user.
Updates the conversion value and verifies the first launch of an app installed as a result of an ad.
Updates the fine and coarse conversion values, and calls a completion handler if the update fails.
Updates the fine and coarse conversion values and indicates whether to send the postback before the conversion window ends, and calls a completion handler if the update fails.
Verifies the first launch of an advertised app and, on subsequent calls, updates the conversion value or calls a completion handler if the update fails.
Specify key values that validate and associate an app installation with an ad campaign.
Set up a source app to participate in ad campaigns.
Prepare an advertised app to participate in ad campaigns.
Initiate install validation by displaying a StoreKit-rendered ad with signed parameters.

abstract.text: Ensure the validity of a postback you receive after an ad conversion by verifying its cryptographic signature.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
